intro: Stillingia salpingadenia subsp. anadena, commonly known as the narrowleaf stillingia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other related species. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to orange, with five petals and a distinctive central stigma. This subspecies is often found in moist, open habitats such as woodland edges and stream banks.
